verses.esv: 7:1 “Judge not, that you be not judged. 2 For with the judgment you pronounce you will be judged, and with the measure you use it will be measured to you. 3 Why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but do not notice the log that is in your own eye? 4 Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Let me take the speck out of your eye,’ when there is the log in your own eye? 5 You hypocrite, first take the log out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take the speck out of your brother’s eye.
verses.kjv: 1 Judge not, that ye be not judged. 2 For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again. 3 And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye? 4 Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, Let me pull out the mote out of thine eye; and, behold, a beam is in thine own eye? 5 Thou hypocrite, first cast out the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother’s eye.
verses.niv: 1 "Do not judge, or you too will be judged. 2 For in the same way you judge others, you will be judged, and with the measure you use, it will be measured to you. 3 "Why do you look at the speck of sawdust in your brother's eye and pay no attention to the plank in your own eye? 4 How can you say to your brother, 'Let me take the speck out of your eye,' when all the time there is a plank in your own eye? 5 You hypocrite, first take the plank out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother's eye.

verses.esv: 11 Do not speak evil against one another, brothers. The one who speaks against a brother or judges his brother, speaks evil against the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law but a judge. 12 There is only one lawgiver and judge, he who is able to save and to destroy. But who are you to judge your neighbor?
verses.kjv: 11 Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of his brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge. 12 There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?
verses.niv: 11 Brothers, do not slander one another. Anyone who speaks against his brother or judges him speaks against the law and judges it. When you judge the law, you are not keeping it, but sitting in judgment on it. 12 There is only one Lawgiver and Judge, the one who is able to save and destroy. But you--who are you to judge your neighbor?

verses.esv: 29 Let no corrupting talk come out of your mouths, but only such as is good for building up, as fits the occasion, that it may give grace to those who hear.
verses.kjv: 29 Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.
verses.niv: 29 Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs, that it may benefit those who listen.

verses.esv: 19 Know this, my beloved brothers: let every person be quick to hear, slow to speak, slow to anger; 20 for the anger of man does not produce the righteousness of God.
verses.kjv: 19 Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath: 20 For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.
verses.niv: 19 My dear brothers, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry, 20 for man's anger does not bring about the righteous life that God desires.

verses.esv: 6:1 Brothers, if anyone is caught in any transgression, you who are spiritual should restore him in a spirit of gentleness. Keep watch on yourself, lest you too be tempted.
verses.kjv: 1 Brethren, if a man be overtaken in a fault, ye which are spiritual, restore such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.
verses.niv: 1 Brothers, if someone is caught in a sin, you who are spiritual should restore him gently. But watch yourself, or you also may be tempted.

verses.esv: 16 All Scripture is breathed out by God and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness,
verses.kjv: 16 All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:
verses.niv: 16 All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness,

verses.esv: 4 Who are you to pass judgment on the servant of another? It is before his own master that he stands or falls. And he will be upheld, for the Lord is able to make him stand.
verses.kjv: 4 Who art thou that judgest another man’s servant? to his own master he standeth or falleth. Yea, he shall be holden up: for God is able to make him stand.
verses.niv: 4 Who are you to judge someone else's servant? To his own master he stands or falls. And he will stand, for the Lord is able to make him stand.

verses.esv:
6   Faithful are the wounds of a friend;
    profuse are the kisses of an enemy.
verses.kjv: 6 Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
verses.niv: 6 Wounds from a friend can be trusted, but an enemy multiplies kisses.

verses.esv:
31   The ear that listens to life-giving reproof
    will dwell among the wise.
verses.kjv: 31 The ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise.
verses.niv: 31 He who listens to a life-giving rebuke will be at home among the wise.

verses.esv: 24 And let us consider how to stir up one another to love and good works,
verses.kjv: 24 And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:
verses.niv: 24 And let us consider how we may spur one another on toward love and good deeds.

verses.esv: 24 And the Lord’s servant must not be quarrelsome but kind to everyone, able to teach, patiently enduring evil, 25 correcting his opponents with gentleness. God may perhaps grant them repentance leading to a knowledge of the truth,
verses.kjv: 24 And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all men, apt to teach, patient, 25 In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;
verses.niv: 24 And the Lord's servant must not quarrel; instead, he must be kind to everyone, able to teach, not resentful. 25 Those who oppose him he must gently instruct, in the hope that God will grant them repentance leading them to a knowledge of the truth,

verses.esv:
15:1   A soft answer turns away wrath,
    but a harsh word stirs up anger.
verses.kjv: 1 A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
verses.niv: 1 A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

verses.esv:
17   Iron sharpens iron,
    and one man sharpens another.
verses.kjv: 17 Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
verses.niv: 17 As iron sharpens iron, so one man sharpens another.

verses.esv:
8   Do not reprove a scoffer, or he will hate you;
    reprove a wise man, and he will love you.
verses.kjv: 8 Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
verses.niv: 8 Do not rebuke a mocker or he will hate you; rebuke a wise man and he will love you.

verses.esv: 15 But if you bite and devour one another, watch out that you are not consumed by one another.
verses.kjv: 15 But if ye bite and devour one another, take heed that ye be not consumed one of another.
verses.niv: 15 If you keep on biting and devouring each other, watch out or you will be destroyed by each other.

verses.esv:
11   A fool gives full vent to his spirit,
    but a wise man quietly holds it back.
verses.kjv: 11 A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.
verses.niv: 11 A fool gives full vent to his anger, but a wise man keeps himself under control.

verses.esv:
5   Better is open rebuke
    than hidden love.
6   Faithful are the wounds of a friend;
    profuse are the kisses of an enemy.
verses.kjv: 5 Open rebuke is better than secret love. 6 Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
verses.niv: 5 Better is open rebuke than hidden love. 6 Wounds from a friend can be trusted, but an enemy multiplies kisses.

verses.esv:
18   Poverty and disgrace come to him who ignores instruction,
    but whoever heeds reproof is honored.
verses.kjv: 18 Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.
verses.niv: 18 He who ignores discipline comes to poverty and shame, but whoever heeds correction is honored.

verses.esv: 11 Therefore encourage one another and build one another up, just as you are doing.
verses.kjv: 11 Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.
verses.niv: 11 Therefore encourage one another and build each other up, just as in fact you are doing.

verses.esv:
13   The fear of the LORD is hatred of evil.
  Pride and arrogance and the way of evil
    and perverted speech I hate.
verses.kjv: 13 The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.
verses.niv: 13 To fear the LORD is to hate evil; I hate pride and arrogance, evil behavior and perverse speech.

verses.esv: 19 Beloved, never avenge yourselves, but leave it to the wrath of God, for it is written, “Vengeance is mine, I will repay, says the Lord.”
verses.kjv: 19 Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.
verses.niv: 19 Do not take revenge, my friends, but leave room for God's wrath, for it is written: "It is mine to avenge; I will repay," says the Lord.

verses.esv: 51 “You stiff-necked people, uncircumcised in heart and ears, you always resist the Holy Spirit. As your fathers did, so do you.
verses.kjv: 51 Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Ghost: as your fathers did, so do ye.
verses.niv: 51 "You stiff-necked people, with uncircumcised hearts and ears! You are just like your fathers: You always resist the Holy Spirit!

verses.esv: 21 For no prophecy was ever produced by the will of man, but men spoke from God as they were carried along by the Holy Spirit.
verses.kjv: 21 For the prophecy came not in old time by the will of man: but holy men of God spake as they were moved by the Holy Ghost.
verses.niv: 21 For prophecy never had its origin in the will of man, but men spoke from God as they were carried along by the Holy Spirit.

verses.esv: 2 For with the judgment you pronounce you will be judged, and with the measure you use it will be measured to you.
verses.kjv: 2 For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.
verses.niv: 2 For in the same way you judge others, you will be judged, and with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.

verses.esv: 14 The natural person does not accept the things of the Spirit of God, for they are folly to him, and he is not able to understand them because they are spiritually discerned.
verses.kjv: 14 But the natural man receiveth not the things of the Spirit of God: for they are foolishness unto him: neither can he know them, because they are spiritually discerned.
verses.niv: 14 The man without the Spirit does not accept the things that come from the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him, and he cannot understand them, because they are spiritually discerned.
